column2: But the difference between what I support and what you support, Vice President Biden, is that you require them to opt in and I would not require them to opt in.
column4: The difference between what I support and what you support, Vice President Biden, is that you require them to opt in (to a Medicare public option), and I would not require them to opt in.  They would automatically be enrolled. Thats a big difference.  Are you forgetting what you said two minutes ago?

column2: They wouldn't have a buy in.

column2: Fifty million of those people lose their private insurance every year when they quit their jobs or they go unemployed or their employer changes their insurance policy.
column4: Was it 150 million people on private insurance? 50 million of those people lose their private insurance every year when they quit their jobs, or they go unemployed, or their employer changes their insurance policy.

column2: Over 90% of the American people think we have to get assault weapons off the street  period.
column4: Over 90% of the American people think we have to get assault weapons off the street  period.

column2: We didn't lock people up in cages.
column4: Says the Obama administration "didn't lock people up in cages."
Says the Obama administration "didn't lock people up in cages."

column2: And it's nice to go all the way back to slavery, but dear God, we have a criminal justice system that is so racially biased, we have more AfricanAmericans under criminal supervision today than all the slaves in 1850.
column4: There are more African American men in prison, jail, on probation or parole than were enslaved in 1850.

column2: I was in the United States Senate when 54 senators said let's do background checks, let's get rid of assault weapons, and with 54 senators, it failed because of the filibuster.
column4: 54 senators said, let's do background checks, let's get rid of assault weapons, and with 54 senators it failed because of the filibuster.
